programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: Up the Ante in El Monte
programme.desc: Brandi and Jarrod try to outwit their rivals at an auction in El Monte, but face disaster if their plan backfires.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team is offered an alternating-current motor invented by 19th-century pioneer Nikola Tesla, and a pair of trainers used in Back to the Future.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Pawn Stars fight for memorabilia from undefeated boxing champ Rocky Marciano, and Rick takes a look at a one-of-a-kind glow-in-the-dark car.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick takes on the challenge of restoring a weighing machine from the 1900s, while the team also tackles a 1930s baby walker.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick works his magic on a vintage Italian bumper car from an antiques shop, while the team repairs a 1970s toy tractor.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: The team is called to assist when a lorry crashes and blocks the road's most important exit. Meanwhile, Scott has a bone to pick with recovery team boss Jamie. Documentary following the work of the Jamie Davis Heavy Rescue team that patrols the Coquihalla Highway on Canada's Cascade Mountains.

programme.title: Stan Lee's Superhumans
programme.desc: A man who can eat inedible objects, a pilot who can subject his body to multiple G-forces, and a martial arts expert who tries to knock people unconscious without touching them.

programme.title: Unusual Suspects
programme.desc: Investigating the story of 17-year-old Michele Avila, a student from Arleta, Los Angeles who was murdered in the Angeles National Forest by two school friends in October 1985.

programme.title: Strippers: Cars for Cash
programme.desc: The teams track down an MGB GT and a Mazda MX-5, as they are challenged to find and strip small and sporty cars. Narrated by John Challis.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les tells a frightening story of a hold-up at his grandfather's store, and a dominatrix brings her gear into the shop.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Members of the Gold family open the doors to their huge Detroit pawn shop once again as they encounter intriguing finds and awkward customers.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank have an unsuccessful search through a pile of junk, but the discovery of a vintage guitar marks a change in their fortunes.

programme.title: Bible Secrets Revealed
programme.desc: Examining the accuracy of the four gospels of Matthew, Mark, Luke and John, sacred texts which apparently contain information about the life of Jesus.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: A team travels to Germany and Poland to investigate a possible connection between the UFO phenomenon and the Third Reich.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick takes on the challenge of restoring a weighing machine from the 1900s, while the team also tackles a 1930s baby walker.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick works his magic on a vintage Italian bumper car from an antiques shop, while the team repairs a 1970s toy tractor.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Corey tries not to be a Scrooge when two first editions of A Christmas Carol appear in the shop, while Rick is rocked when a meteorite drops in.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Chumlee checks out two classic pinball machines, while Rick turns his attention to a carrier pigeon capsule from the First World War and decides to take up boxing.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers return to Montebello, California, where Rene and Casey unsuccessfully try to throw off the competition. Ivy secures his skating equipment.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Rene and Casey attempt to shut out Jarrod and Brandi, Darrell uncovers an interesting locker, while Ivy meets a furry friend. Reality series following people who make a living from bidding for the contents of abandoned storage units.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les tells a frightening story of a hold-up at his grandfather's store, and a dominatrix brings her gear into the shop.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Members of the Gold family open the doors to their huge Detroit pawn shop once again as they encounter intriguing finds and awkward customers.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: Four bladesmiths salvage steel from a junkyard to create signature blades using a hand-cranked coal forge, then two smiths have five days to create a Dayak war sword, the Pandat.

programme.title: America's Book of Secrets
programme.desc: A look at the scandals that have rocked the secret service, its gruelling selection process and the people and secrets that its highly trained agents protect.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: The team from UFO Magazine examines the most compelling examples of UFO relics available, such as a unique and other-worldly piece of metal in Missouri.

programme.title: Bible Secrets Revealed
programme.desc: Investigating Biblical prophecies, which are said to be messages and warnings sent from God, asking what they really foretell and if they could predict mankind's future.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The Gold family and its employees are ready to haggle as members of the public continue to bring in their unique items in the hope of raising some cash.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A customer wants to sell a coat allegedly made of rare monkey fur. Seth is tempted to make a purchase that could prove beneficial to the finances of the business.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Ivy tries to keep his winning streak going, while Darrell and Rene play mind games with each other. Jarrod and Brandi visit a crime scene and travel back in time.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Brandi is intent on closing the Long Beach store, but Jarrod is determined to save it by scoring more lockers. Ivy tries to intimidate other buyers, while Darrell gets the shock treatment.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna
programme.desc: Tyler is still angry with his friends for their behaviour from the previous week, and when they continue to play-up on the water he reaches breaking point.

programme.title: Mountain Men
programme.desc: A mid-winter melt threatens to derail Tom's season. Eustace masters gravity to keep the water flowing at home, while Jason and Mary make a move to feed their growing family. Morgan and Margaret top off a major project and Mike cashes in on a rare find.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: Troy and Guy race to fill tags as the end of the season looms near, while Jacob and Chase have a surprise encounter fishing in their backyard.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: The Landrys race to tag out at the end of the season, but they have company, as RJ and Jay Paul invade their territory looking to tag out themselves.

programme.title: Dave Gorman: Terms and Conditions Apply
programme.desc: Using his trademark, powerpoint-comedy and a series of mischievous games, Dave invites three of the country's finest comic minds to help him make sense of our insensible world. In the first episode he is joined by Richard Osman, Phil Wang and Sara Barron, as they take a deep dive into the details we usually miss.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry quizzes Alan Davies, Jo Brand, Phill Jupitus and Clive Anderson on subjects as diverse as clowns, cuckoos and Cinderella in the mind-boggling panel game.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.sub-title: Would I Lie to You? At Christmas
programme.desc: Rob Brydon hosts a festive edition of the comedy panel show in which the participants aim to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory. Joining team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack for the Christmas fun are former Test Match Special commentator Henry Blofeld, Witless star Kerry Howard, broadcaster the Rev Richard Coles and BBC News presenter Clive Myrie. They all reveal amazing stories, but are they telling the truth, or making it all up?.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Rob Brydon hosts the comedy panel show in which the participants aim to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory. Joining regular team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are snooker veteran Steve Davis, actor Craig Parkinson, comedian Sara Pascoe and Strictly co-host Claudia Winkleman. They all have amazing stories to share, but whether or not they are true or works of fiction remains to be seen.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts the quiz with a difference as comedians Sara Pascoe, Stephen K Amos and Jason Manford join regular panellist Alan Davies to answer questions on the theme of plants, with points being awarded not only for correct answers, but also for interesting ones.

programme.title: The Last Man on Earth
programme.desc: The group throw a party to celebrate every major holiday, but Phil and Todd clash.

programme.title: The Last Man on Earth
programme.desc: The post-apocalyptic comedy flashes forward six months, where Erica and Carol are heavily pregnant, Jasper is now talking and Melissa has regained her sanity.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: James May's Cars of the People
programme.desc: The presenter examines how the car industry in Germany and Japan blossomed following the Second World War, becoming manufacturing giants that far outstripped the Allied nations that had defeated them. He test drives some of the vehicles Germany and Japan produced during the post-war period, as well as an assortment of other classic cars, including E-Types and Mustangs. He also reveals the sad tale of the Austin Allegro, a vehicle that had a devastating impact on the British car industry.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz go all Scooby Doo on Halloween as they pick an abandoned theme park and a ghoulish former prison.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: As auctioneer Sean Kelly and the team arrive in Gwent, Heavy D confuses the other bidders and himself. Meanwhile, Nat takes a gamble, but John is far from happy.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: US host Sean Kelly oversees UK bidders battling to win potential treasures found in storage containers, lock-ups and garages in Leeds.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys go in search of a motorcycle that once belonged to Bonnie and Clyde.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The Black Keys' frontman Dan Auerbach makes a special guest appearance as Mike plans to flip a vintage guitar.

programme.title: James May's Cars of the People
programme.desc: James charts the history of 4x4 vehicles from the jeeps of the Second World war onwards, revealing how they rose in popularity in everyday use and in rallies. He explores the rivalry between Land Rover and Land Cruiser, and puts some classic vehicles through their paces by driving up Mount Fuji and through the Mojave desert.

programme.title: World's Most Dangerous Roads
programme.desc: Celebrities undertake journeys on some of the most perilous routes in the world. In Alaska, Sue Perkins and Charley Boorman drive along the notorious Dalton Highway, a dirt track originally constructed in the 1970s as a supply road for the Trans-Alaska oil pipeline. The pair struggle to cope with the Arctic conditions and constant threat of avalanches, but receive help from experienced truckers who teach them some unwritten rules for surviving the road's many hazards.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson puts the Renaultsport Twingo 133 through a stringent examination in Belfast - with a helping hand from actor Ross Kemp. Richard Hammond samples the delights of racing airport vehicles, and James May takes the Vauxhall Insignia VXR for a drive in the company of Margaret Calvert, whose ideas were central to the design of modern British road signs. Film director Guy Ritchie is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car, and there is also a group test of high-performance off-roaders from BMW, Audi and Range Rover.

programme.title: Timber Kings
programme.desc: Peter meets his match with a client. Beat and Andre trade a viewing platform for Motocross lessons, and Brian creates the tree fort of his childhood dreams.

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop
programme.desc: John, Dave and Ros get an excuse to show off their knowledge of the second-hand police car market when end of service service vehicles are put up for auction.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The hosts bid to prove that cars can be art by filling a gallery in Middlesbrough with motoring-related works, including a few creations of their own. They also resort to unusual promotional techniques to attract more visitors to their exhibition. Back on the track, Jeremy Clarkson tests British supercar the Noble M600. Jenson Button drives the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: In Austin, Eddie Hall takes on Superbike legend Colin 'Texas Tornado' Edwards in a strength vs speed race - and sets his own eating challenge from eight of the city's food trucks.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: In Manhattan, Eddie Hall goes head to head with long-time rival Brian Shaw, pulling a 23-tonne truck - and attempting the notorious skyscraper 'Monster' sandwich from Sarge's Deli.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedy panel show, hosted by Rob Brydon, in which team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by celebrity guests Nikki Fox, Miles Jupp, Nish Kumar and Joe Lycett to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedy panel show, hosted by Rob Brydon, in which team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by celebrity guests Adrian Edmondson, Claude Littner, Cariad Lloyd and Jordan Stephens to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry quizzes Alan Davies, Jo Brand, Phill Jupitus and Clive Anderson on subjects as diverse as clowns, cuckoos and Cinderella in the mind-boggling panel game.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig considers the subjects of pain and punishment, with guests Jimmy Carr, Lee Mack and Alice Levine joining regular Alan Davies on the panel.

programme.title: Jon Richardson: Ultimate Worrier
programme.desc: Jon and guests Josh Widdicombe, John Robins and Holly Walsh discuss, categorise and rank People worries. Are greetings getting out of hand? Are robots doing all our thinking?.

programme.title: Comedians Giving Lectures
programme.desc: Comedians Massive Dad, Russell Kane and Phil Wang are given the titles of real lectures and invited to give their own version. Presented by Sara Pascoe.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Christmas special of the quiz show from 2006 in which host Stephen Fry decorates the Tree of Knowledge. Joining him are regular contributor Alan Davies, as well as guests Jo Brand, Dara O Briain and Rich Hall. As usual the questions are so difficult that points are awarded for the most interesting answers.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A strange-looking town with a supernatural atmosphere, a collection of imposing buildings in southern Australia, and the remains of curious-looking basins emerging from the waves.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: Ffestiniog and Welsh Highland Railway are celebrating their annual Victorian Weekend, while in south Devon, silver service waiter Andy Leech runs the three-course Sunday lunch.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: One of the largest Nazi bunkers ever constructed, outside the French town of Watten, a missile facility with storage for 108 missiles, a liquid oxygen factory and two launch pads.

programme.title: Slow Train Through Africa with Griff Rhys Jones
programme.desc: The comedian begins the next leg of his trip in Kasama, northern Zambia. His first stop is the town of Mpika, where he meets college students training to be locomotive drivers. Next, in the capital Lusaka, he reveals how the first railways were built to access the country's rich mineral wealth, and watches craftsmen cutting emeralds and rubies - before being let loose on a pair of bejewelled cufflinks. Griff then reaches the spectacular Victoria Falls on his way to Zimbabwe's second-largest city, Bulawayo.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Operation Grand Canyon with Dan Snow
programme.desc: Part two of two. The historian and his team continue down the Colorado River in antique wooden boats as they re-create the pioneering 280-mile expedition through the Grand Canyon that was led by explorer John Wesley Powell in 1869. Along the way they carry out the same surveying tasks as the original party with period equipment, including taking photographs with a 19th-century 3D camera.

programme.title: Slow Train Through Africa with Griff Rhys Jones
programme.desc: The comedian makes five train journeys taking in the spectacular sights of Africa, travelling to unexpected places in deserts and forests, villages and cities, and finding out how the railways are used today. On the fourth leg of his journey across the continent, Griff travels across Namibia in the south-west, experiencing luxury camping, encountering cheetahs, and visiting 1,000-foot sand dunes.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team head to the Lake District to look for copper, a forgotten piece of the nation's industrial heritage. There are nearly two dozen old mines across the mountains, some thought to have been established 400 years ago when the valleys would have been studded with workshops, scaffolding and water-powered machines, home to a brave band of Tudor miners. The team battles the rain, wind and dangerously unstable trackways, but the combination of sheer effort and hi-tech kit enables the experts to access the heart of an old mine.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: The team heads to the small county of Rutland to visit Oakham Castle, the most well-preserved 12th-century building in Britain. It was once home to the Norman knight Walkelin de Ferrers, who fought alongside Richard the Lionheart in the Crusades, and before that the residence of several Saxon kings and queens. Tony and the crew investigate de Ferrers' long-lost private quarters, but it takes three days of twists and turns to determine what the site looked like 900 years ago. To mark the visit, they also cast a giant Time Team horseshoe to add to the collection that has decorated the castle hall for half a millennium.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.sub-title: Dag Bromberg: A City in the Forest
programme.desc: As the Red Army approached a forest in Poland toward the end of the war, they stumbled upon a massive complex containing more than a thousand structures across 25sqkm.

programme.title: Viking Dead
programme.sub-title: The Lost Viking Fleet of Roskilde
programme.desc: The remains of a fleet of Viking boats, and the modern historians attempting to recreate them.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: How some of our greatest railways have challenged engineering's finest minds in their efforts to conquer the planet's waterways, including a tunnel beneath the English Channel.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: The team heads to the small county of Rutland to visit Oakham Castle, the most well-preserved 12th-century building in Britain. It was once home to the Norman knight Walkelin de Ferrers, who fought alongside Richard the Lionheart in the Crusades, and before that the residence of several Saxon kings and queens. Tony and the crew investigate de Ferrers' long-lost private quarters, but it takes three days of twists and turns to determine what the site looked like 900 years ago. To mark the visit, they also cast a giant Time Team horseshoe to add to the collection that has decorated the castle hall for half a millennium.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough reveals why male seahorses give birth, and looks at how hyena packs are dominated by the female members.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores nature's evolutionary anomalies and examines creatures whose stretched features have given them an edge in the natural world.

programme.title: Life in the Undergrowth
programme.desc: David Attenborough turns his attention to the network of partnerships that invertebrates have developed with one another and with plants. He reveals how the fairy wasp, the world's smallest insect, flies underwater to inject its eggs into those of the water beetle. Footage also shows how the caterpillar of the blue butterfly smuggles its way into an ants' nest by mimicking the smell of their young.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A look at the US navy's most advanced nuclear submarine - which can remain underwater for months at a time - examining the previous vessels that influenced it.

programme.title: Viking Dead
programme.sub-title: The Lost Viking Fleet of Roskilde
programme.desc: The remains of a fleet of Viking boats, and the modern historians attempting to recreate them.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.sub-title: Dag Bromberg: A City in the Forest
programme.desc: As the Red Army approached a forest in Poland toward the end of the war, they stumbled upon a massive complex containing more than a thousand structures across 25sqkm.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: A look at the planet's most incredible metropolitan railways, and how they help people solve distinctly urban problems. Including a project to upgrade New York's transit system.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: On the Welsh Highland Railway, a newly built Pullman carriage is on its way to Caernarfon Station and a Saddle Tank Loco is being completely restored on the East Lancashire Railway.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A little-known dark past explains the vast monolithic structures that dominate the small British island of Guernsey.

programme.title: Underground Worlds
programme.desc: A look at some of Switzerland's 300,000 subterranean bunkers, built across history. Plus, the extraordinary creation of a Liverpool entrepreneur that's shrouded in mystery, and a network of man-made tunnels used by adventurous subterranean thrill-seekers deep beneath Slovenia's landscape.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A look at the US navy's most advanced nuclear submarine - which can remain underwater for months at a time - examining the previous vessels that influenced it.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Double bill. A suspected paedophile is found dead in a playground, so inexperienced detective Rory Drennan calls in Nikki and Jack to attend. It's not long before the team links his murder to the case of a missing young girl, so the child-protection officers are also brought in - though it soon becomes apparent the youngster's social worker blames herself for the disappearance. Starring Emilia Fox, David Caves and Richard Lintern, with Claudie Blakley, Lorraine Burroughs and John Dagliesh.

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.desc: Hugh is facing his biggest crisis yet when his love life, career and family are all in desperate need of a help. Also, Charlie plays dirty to win back Matt.

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.desc: Hugh and the hospital staff use blackmail to get rid of their incompetent boss Norah, while Penny faces family and romantic dilemmas that will change her future.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward presents from Birmingham's Uplands Allotment, where an array of unusual plants and vegetables are on display.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: Beatrice considers her future with Jack and leaves Evie dumbfounded by accepting Larry Cotter's proposal to join forces and venture into ready-to-wear.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The officers and their wives head out to Cyprus. The men make a number of mistakes on exercise but are redeemed when they intervene in a critical situation.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Dave almost drowns during a beach landing exercise. Meanwhile, Donna's sister Kelly falls for one of the locals and Major Kieran Voce has divided loyalties over his love life.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Diane brings Jack to work with her and is warned that she must choose between motherhood and her career. Her predicament is made a little easier when Owen offers to help in any way he can. Mubbs tries to make amends with Rosie, while Mickie and Donna settle their differences and Connie resorts to emotional blackmail to get her own way. Medical drama, starring Patricia Potter.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Dale realises that Kerry has embarked on a foolhardy undercover mission to investigate the Radford clan and tracks her down, begging her to pull out before it's too late - but she turns a deaf ear to his pleas, putting both their lives in peril. Newlyweds Jim and June return to Sun Hill to be met by a mob of journalists baying for Adam's blood, while Reg begins to have second thoughts about pursuing a relationship with Marilyn.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Although she and Dale are rescued from the Radfords' murderous clutches, Kerry's problems are just beginning as Gina gets wind of her undercover mission and vows to end her career in the force. A heated argument between Adam and Rob ends with the latter being issued a formal warning, and Sam fears the worst when her teenage daughter Abi goes missing. A paedophilia case reopens old wounds for Terry - but can he explain to a shocked Ramani why he accessed a child pornography website?.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: When Michelle goes to visit Clyde, she doesn't get quite the reception she expects.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Ricky has stopped talking to Pat, and Frank knows why.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: A psychotic mother ties up and gags her children in the boot of her car, admitting she has no feelings for them. Mike Barratt returns from Africa on a temporary contract, while Trevor remains in a vegetative state following his accident and Baz is told she needs an emergency caesarean.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The dealer recruits con artists Matron Jackie, Gideon and Henry the Hearse Chaser to attend an auction where he is selling a painting, to purposely bid against each other to bump up the price. However, Lady Jane also bids and after discovering the ruse concocts a plan to get her own back and wipe the smile off Lovejoy's face. Charlotte Cornwell guest stars with Ian McShane and Phyllis Logan.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Drug addict Terri Fuller arrives on Jersey with policewoman Liz Phillips under the witness protection scheme, as she is due to testify against her gangster boyfriend. Only Jim and Liz know her exact whereabouts, but a call to London to a journalist puts her pursuers in the picture. Jim foils an attempt to snatch her, but his problems are only just beginning. John Nettles stars.

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.sub-title: Keeping Up Appearances Xmas 1991: The Father Christmas Suit
programme.desc: Hyacinth makes Richard dress as Father Christmas to hand out presents to the old folk at the church hall. Unfortunately, he visits Emmet on the way and they get drunk, leaving Elizabeth to don the costume and take his place - without Mrs Bucket noticing the switch. Festive special from 1991, starring Patricia Routledge, Clive Swift and Geoffrey Hughes.

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Hyacinth puts all her efforts into directing a pageant based on the Civil War, with herself as Queen Henrietta Maria and Richard as Charles I. However, all of the volunteers supposedly taking part are unable to make it, so in desperation she invites Onslow, Daisy, Rose, Bruce, Cavalier and Violet to participate. Suburban comedy, guest starring Una Stubbs alongside starring Patricia Routledge, Clive Swift and Geoffrey Hughes.

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Social climber Hyacinth finds herself all at sea when she makes an unexpected discovery during a QE2 cruise that threatens to jeopardise her dream trip. Christmas special from 1993, starring Patricia Routledge, Clive Swift and Geoffrey Hughes.

programme.title: The Inspector Lynley Mysteries
programme.sub-title: In the Blink of an Eye
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The detective investigates when former war photographer Peter Rooker is found shot dead. It is not long before he uncovers a trail leading from tabloid newspaper baron Eddie Price and editor Melissa Booth to an executed Bosnian family, but when he enlists his wife's help in determining the psychological history behind the murder, a fatal chain of events begins.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Double bill. A nanny working for a Russian oligarch is killed in a botched assassination attempt, a bloody shootout that also leaves an unknown hitman dead. As the team joins forces with young DI Sarah Parks to ascertain the identity of the dead would-be assassin, further questions begin to mount - who would want the businessman dead, and why? Two-part story, starring Emilia Fox, David Caves and Richard Lintern, with Lauren O'Neil, Pippa Haywood and Shaun Dingwall.

programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: Bancroft
programme.desc: Katherine and Joe's relationship progresses, while events take a grisly turn for the Kamara family - forcing Bancroft to offer Daanish a deal. programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David and his dealers are in Manchester, where the visitors include a five-year-old girl who holds her own against Simon Schneider, while David Ford tries to win some Moorcroft pottery.

programme.title: The Switch
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Sanjeev Bhaskar in which players four contestants can accumulate big cash totals by answering questions in a series of rounds that alternate between easy and hard, before one gets to the final stage and the chance to double the prize pot.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: Cash Trapped
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Bradley Walsh in which six contestants battle it out across a series of fast-paced question rounds where the players must actively try to sabotage their opponents by beating them to the buzzer and trapping them out of the game. In the final round, the person who has earned the most cash will go head to head against the rest of the group to try to take their winnings home.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Aaron sinks into despair, Liv suffers another seizure, and Nate readies himself for a fight.

programme.title: What's on Scotland

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Kim's actions leave everyone shocked, Liv is in peril, and Tracy's apology backfires.

programme.title: Gino's Italian Escape
programme.desc: The chef leaves Verona on one of Italy's super-fast trains and heads to Lake Garda, the biggest of the Italian lakes. Here he meets a team of rowers training for their annual regatta. After trying his hand at rowing, Gino cooks up a hearty sausage and bean casserole, before jumping on the train and heading to the city of Bolzano. There he creates a deconstructed apple crumble.

programme.title: The Big Quiz
programme.sub-title: The Big Soap Quiz: Coronation Street v Emmerdale
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the annual clash between ITV's biggest soaps, with team captains Jack P Shepherd (David Platt) and Mark Charnock (Marlon Dingle) returning to lead colleagues from Coronation Street and Emmerdale in a battle to find out who knows their soap best. Lining up from the cobbles are Sue Nicholls (Audrey Roberts), Alan Halsall (Tyrone Dobbs) and Alexandra Mardell (Emma Brooker), while making their way from the Dales are Lisa Riley (Mandy Dingle), Isabel Hodgins (Victoria Sugden) and Nick Miles (Jimmy King).

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: The explosion of 90,000 tons of ammunition, how two cranes fell 50 storeys during an earthquake in Taiwan and the 1937 Hindenburg airship disaster. Presented by Ron Pitts.

programme.title: Swamp Loggers

programme.title: Overhaulin' Chronicles

programme.title: World's Deadliest Drivers
programme.desc: More than 50 million people are injured every year on the roads, sparking a boom in dashboard cameras that capture a wealth of fascinating and surprising footage.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Experienced dirt-road driver Dennis Dent goes head to head with a lifelong enemy, while Christian Reynolds takes on the wild back country on a vital mission to build a bridge.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer takes a risk at auction by purchasing a late Alfasud 1.5 TI with no service history, dodgy brakes, and clapped out suspension, hoping mechanic Edd China can work his usual magic on the vehicle.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini auctions off some of his collection, including a Willys MB Jeep, a Jones Grand Prix Hydroplane boat and a Ford F250 Good Humor Truck.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne flies out to Oregon and tries to fix up an untouched 1932 Stutz DV32, in the hope of selling it on for a profit.

programme.title: Blowing Up History
programme.desc: The documentary series switches focus from ancient civilisations to more modern periods, investigating the secrets Victorian architects hid within the Palace of Westminster.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: The Rookies' relationship is on the rocks as they battle their biggest claim yet as well as each other. With two partners working at different speeds, there's a fight brewing.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The Alaskan king crab fishing fleet risks heavy storms to continue the dangerous pursuit of its valuable prey. The Rollo's GPS malfunctions in blizzard conditions, but the crew of the Time Bandit enjoy more success.

programme.title: Treasure Quest
programme.desc: The Odyssey crew is joined by U-boat expert Dr Axel Niestle to investigate the wreck sites of the Second World War in a search for unidentified Nazi submarines.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: In Lancashire, Drew Pritchard visits a sprawling salvage yard that yields many unique items. Next, at an auction house, he faces off against other dealers in a bidding war.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Turbo is fighting to stay on track and on schedule to complete a marathon trek home. Meanwhile, in Tasmania, Euan is hitching a ride to deliver a volatile road.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer finds a Porsche 914 in a barn and thinks he can turn a profit on the 1970s sports car. Edd China has the tricky job of restoring it to a saleable condition.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: It seems it's the last chance for the Rookies' partnership. Meanwhile, the Cooke brothers contend with broken hoses and breakdowns in their quest to strike it rich.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits a quirky house in Suffolk, to discover a barn full of salvage from around the globe.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard spots a 1960s Mini that may be for sale - can he buy it at a good price? Plus, a Cotswold dealer has a Porsche 928, but the budget is hit by some major repairs.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Sales supremo Mike Brewer has always wanted to have an old Caterham in the workshop, but mechanic Edd China decides to take a risk by painting it a shocking colour.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The production of insulin from a loaf of bread, the manufacture of rigging for ships and how green salad is cultivated on scorching desert planes.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The construction of the world's most powerful locomotive, how cows' milk is turned into clotted cream, and the crafting of a boomerang from a piece of wood.

programme.title: Katie Price: My Crazy Life
programme.desc: Part two of two. As Katie accepts an award in Dublin, tensions mount in her love life. With the prospect of bankruptcy looming, she recruits expert help to control her spending.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: The tools of detection are at the forefront of technology. This programme reveals the groundbreaking techniques being employed to catch deadly killers.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of Beth von Steinner. Days after she was reported missing, her frozen body was found behind her house. With no witnesses or suspects, only CCTV footage could reveal the exact fate that had behallen her.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of Cindy Borton, who was found stabbed to death in her Iowa home. Detectives suspected those closest to her, before a note left at the site of an arson fire turned the investigation on its head.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: A series of bank robberies in Texas leaves police baffled, but when similar crimes begin in California the next year the FBI are quick to make a connection.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: The team looks back on its most memorable rescues. Plus, updates on the progress of some of the animals saved.

programme.title: The Detectives: My Killer Case
programme.desc: Disturbing crimes from across the UK are unpacked and retold in intimate detail through police files, CCTV footage and accounts from those who helped solve them..

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: A Dress Like None the Rest
programme.desc: A model who has worn many wedding dresses for photo shoots fears the gown for her own big day will not feel special as a result. A man helps his daughter find the right dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Crystal seeks a dress designed by Pnina Tornai, while Deborah feels a strong connection with Diana, Princess of Wales, and is determined to have her own royal wedding.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: A customer wants to look like a princess, but her aunt would prefer a more grown-up look. A woman renewing her wedding vows seeks a perfect dress for the occasion.

programme.title: Bondi Vet: Coast to Coast
programme.desc: Series featuring vets from locations all over Australia, including Dr Peter Ricci, Dr Alex Hynes, Dr Kate Adams, Dr Lewis Hunt and Dr Danni Dusek. In this episode, Dr Kate discovers dachshund Gary has a life-threatening condition. Dr Alex is under pressure to deliver 12 puppies, and Dr Peter performs surgery on a lion.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: A pregnant mare is rescued and the animal welfare officers find themselves in danger when they encounter a pack of fierce fighting dogs.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: The officers are faced with the difficult task of freeing a puppy trapped under a house as the temperature soars in Texas.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore transforms three items reclaimed from a tip in Witley, Surrey with screen printer Daniel Heath given the task of making a wooden tea trolley desirable again.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How killers try to mislead detectives by making a murder look like suicide, and the role of forensics in establishing the truth.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 22-year-old Bradyn Fuksa, who vanished in July 2009 after taking a mysterious 10-hour journey from Kansas to Wyoming before abandoning his vehicle.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of Tanya Rider, who disappeared in September 2007 on her way home from work in Maple Valley, Washington. Barely alive, she was discovered eight days later at the bottom of a steep ravine inside her wrecked car.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Julianna wants a dress like one Pippa Middleton wore to the wedding of her sister the Duchess of Cambridge, but her opinionated friends have very different ideas in mind.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: War widow Rebecca has found love again but is unable to connect emotionally with a dress, so Flo and Robin hunt for the perfect gown to help her make a fresh start.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Southern belle Alexa looks for a form-fitting traditional lace gown, but her friend is very hard to please.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Megan is on the search for a gown to match her 'Southern Chic' wedding theme. The problem is, nobody at the salon knows exactly what this is - not even the bride.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Heather's fiance acts like a drill sergeant when picking out dresses and the bride soon becomes frustrated with his bad attitude.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A woman's brash mother causes her bridesmaids to feel self-conscious in their dresses, giving consultant Nikky a lot of work to do.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Big Bliss
programme.desc: A bride is determined to outshine her sister, and a customer has a special visitor during her fitting.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Big Bliss
programme.desc: A bride is having a Batman-themed wedding and wants a dress inspired by her favourite villain, while another customer has high expectations for her gown.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Modern-day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard makes a startling find at a 13th-century house in the Lake District. Later, he visits a classic car collector in Hertfordshire.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore transforms three items reclaimed from a tip in Witley, Surrey with screen printer Daniel Heath given the task of making a wooden tea trolley desirable again.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Part one of two. Jeanne is concerned that she'll never get the weight-loss surgery that could save her life. An unexpected death halts her progress.

programme.title: Faking It: Tears of a Crime
programme.desc: The murder of best-selling author Helen Bailey by her partner Ian Stewart, who had earlier helped volunteers in her search. The 51-year-old's body was eventually found dumped in a cesspit beneath the garage of her 1.5million home in Royston, Hertfordshire, alongside that of her dog in July 2016. She had been drugged and suffocated.

programme.title: The Killer in My Family
programme.desc: Relatives of 'The Pillow Pyro' John Orr reveal how his shocking crimes impacted the family and community, and discuss whether there were any signs of his murderous intentions.

programme.title: 10 Steps to Murder
programme.desc: Detectives, friends and family reveal the twists and turns that led to tragedy, and where it all went wrong - revealing the 10 steps to murder..
